INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Normally additional processing is not done on detected NAT devices, as they are usually against the AUP., hence the add to group action is disabled.
This sub-rule quickly identifies any NAT devices on the network so that IT staff can remove them from the network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: NAT Devices

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Windows" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Windows sub-policy. All detected Windows devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
When Windows devices are not manageable by CounterACT the remaining sub-policies use various available attributes to separate possible corporate machines needing maintenance from suspected guests and known unauthorized windows devices.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.1.1.1 Windows OS Clarification

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Machines managed via the Host Property Scanner Domain Credentials are added the "Managed Windows Devices" group. "Start SecureConnector" action is performed to deploy SC agent to endpoint.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Domain Managed (Current) No SecureConnector

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This sub-policy identifies machines that have changed state and are not currently manageable
This can identify possible issues with the Windows infrastructure and should be investigated for root cause.
This is also a safety mechanism to keep corporate hosts from becoming restricted if such a condition is detected.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Previously Domain Managed

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This rule identifies unmanaged machines that have been manually approved and exempted by a CounterACT administrator via the "Exempt-Approved Windows Devices" group.
This should be used when a known quantity Windows machine must remain on the network but cannot be managed (technical or political justification).
INNER_RULE.NAME: Manually Approved Windows Devices

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This sub-policy identifies machines that are members of a Domain defined in the PS plugin but are not manageable.
Typically these machines need maintenance to become managed, or should be manually exempted after approval.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Domain Member but NOT Manageable

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Machines that are using the correct NetBIOS domain/workgroup name, but are not manageable via domain credentials and have not been verified as actual Domain members will be identified by this policy.
These can include: - Machines with broken Domain accounts (need to be re-joined - Machines impersonating the domain name, but are in a Workgroup. - Misconfigured lab or test machines
These should be investigated and legitimate machines remediated.
INNER_RULE.NAME: DEV NetBIOS Domain

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Identifies machines with NetBIOS domain names of "WorkGroup" or MSHome.
Should be handled per the organizations security policy.
May include inserting actions to add to blocked or restricted access.
INNER_RULE.NAME: WORKGROUP or MSHome NetBIOS Domain

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Identifies machines with NetBIOS domain names of "Sample".
Should be handled per the organizations security policy.
May include inserting actions to add to blocked or restricted access.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Sample NetBIOS Domain Names

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This sub-policy identifies misc. NetBIOS domain and workgroup names that have been discovered on the network.
Authorized Domain names may need to be separated from this rule in a similar fashion to the Corp NetBIOS Domain Name sub-policy.
This allows for tracking a baseline of machines in non-standard Domains that must exist on the network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Misc NetBIOS Domain Names

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This sub-policy utilizes SPAN traffic detected on the Channel to separate machines that are not managed, and do not present other properties on the network, BUT have successfully authenticated to one of the defined Authentication servers.
This allows event based detection to provide a layer of trust that there is at least a valid domain account on the other end on the unmanaged IP. These machines are still not compliant, but are actively communicating via valid domain credentials.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Auth traffic detected within the last 3 days

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Also utilizing SPAN traffic events this policy separates machines that have not authenticated, but are actively using the HTTP protocol.
This indicates that an HTTP notification or redirection will have a high probability of notifying the endpoint of an issue or presenting a compliance of guest registration portal web page.
INNER_RULE.NAME: HTTP traffic detected within the last 3 days <CHANGE IP>

PARAM.NAME: server
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: port
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: ident
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: priority
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
The remaining Windows devices that have not provided enough properties for host Clarification or events detected on the SPAN interface.
This is typically the one of the first places to begin enforcement/remediation actions.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unknown Windows Machines

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Linux/Unix" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Linux sub-policy. All detected Linux/Unix devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
If Linux\Unix devices are not manageable by CounterACT via either SSH key or SecureConnector, or manually approved via an Exemption, the policy will separate them into hosts with port 22 available, but not manageable and hosts with no management port open.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "Managed Nix Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.1.2.1 Linux/Unix OS Clarification

If Macintosh devices are not manageable by CounterACT via either SSH key or SecureConnector, or manually approved via an Exemption, the policy will separate them into hosts with port 22 available, but not manageable and hosts with no management port open.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "ManagedMacintosh Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.1.2.2 Macintosh OS Clarification

RULE.DESCRIPTION: A basic Mobile Device Classify policy for general use. If there is an MDM orchestration, this policy will need to be modified.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.1.3.1 Mobile Devices

RULE.DESCRIPTION: While most NAT devices will require immediate investigation and remediation, it is possible that some are allowed. This policy will separate the Exempt NAT Devices from all NAT devices detected, and notify the Default CounterACT admin via email action of unauthorized NAT devices on the network.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.2.2 NAT Devices Clarification

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: NAT devices which have been manually added to the "Exempt NAT Devices" group are detected by this subrule and separated from unauthorized NAT devices.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Approved NAT devices

PARAM.VALUE: CounterACT: Rogue NAT Device detected at {ip}

This policy runs on the "Network Devices" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Network sub-policy. All detected Network devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
The sub-policies check for manageability using the SNMP strings that are also used by the Switch Plugin.
Intended usage is to baseline network devices and managed vs unmanaged switches outside of the switch plugin for comparison and tuning.

RULE.DESCRIPTION: This policy takes as input the last subrule of the Enterprise Discovery policy. You can modify a copy of this policy to a specific IoT range if required, by modifying the scope and filter.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.3.01 IoT

PATH.VALUE: Operational Technology/Non-Industry Specific/Facilities/Building Automation/Uninterruptible Power Supply
Operational Technology/Energy & Power/Energy & Power - Industrial Control Systems
Operational Technology/Energy & Power/Energy & Power - Industrial Control Systems

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Devices that were not able to be classified by the 1.1 Classification rule are passed to the Clarification layer via this policy.
The subsequent sub-policies break these unclassified IPs into buckets based on generic properties or event driven information.
The intention is to organize these into working buckets allowing for investigation where needed or, based on groups of properties, possibly highlight a profile that can be added to the Classification policy to properly classify a set of devices that slipped through initially as unclassified.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.4.1 Unclassified Device Clarification

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
As a safety mechanism, separate any known server or sensitive device networks/VLANs/IPs so that they can be processed outside of standard client interaction if needed.
Use segments if it is possible to define them accurately within the segment hierarchy.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Server Networks Safety <CHANGE IP>

PARAM.NAME: facility
PARAM.VALUE: Click here to replace default value

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
IMPROPER IMPLEMENTATION CAN TAKE DOWN A NETWORK.
This Scope has been intentionally broken to prevent network issues caused by pushing Microsoft CAB update file without forethought of network design in specific environments.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.1.7 Windows OS Update Assessment <Edit Scope>

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE:
Dear {user},
Your computer was found to be missing important security updates. The system attempted to apply these updates during the last hour. However, not all updates were successful.
Please run "Windows Update" to complete the update. Alternatively, Please follow all the links below to update manually. When finished, please click "Recheck my computer" to continue.

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE:
Dear {user},
Your computer was found to be missing important security updates. The system attempted to apply these updates during the last hour. However, not all updates were successful.
Please run "Windows Update" to complete the update. Alternatively, Please follow all the links below to update manually. When finished, please click "Recheck my computer" to continue.

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE:
Dear {user},
Your computer was found to be missing important security updates. The system attempted to apply these updates during the last hour. However, not all updates were successful.
Please run "Windows Update" to complete the update. Alternatively, Please follow all the links below to update manually. When finished, please click "Recheck my computer" to continue.

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE:
Dear {user},
Your computer was found to be missing important security updates. The system attempted to apply these updates during the last hour. However, not all updates were successful.
Please run "Windows Update" to complete the update. Alternatively, Please follow all the links below to update manually. When finished, please click "Recheck my computer" to continue.

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Edit AV vendor in sub-rules 1 and 2. Also enable add to group action in sub-rule 2 if customer considers "AV not up to date" to be non compliant.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.1.1 Antivirus Assessment

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Any Supported AV Running - 1 Week Update Date
INNER_RULE.NAME: Windows Defender Running & Up to Date

CONDITION.LABEL: Windows Antivirus Update Date :Value : Windows Defender

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Any Supported AV Running but 2 or more weeks out of date. An action does exist to initiate a Antivirus Update. Use at customer discretion.

INNER_RULE.NAME: Windows Defender Installed & Not Running

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Minimal devices should be present
INNER_RULE.NAME: Irresolvable

INNER_RULE.NAME: P2P Running

Disk Encryption Installed and Not Encrypted

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Edit the subrules to configure the Add to Group "AntiVirus Non Compliant" for every subrule where this is the case for the deployment.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.2.1 Mac OS AV Assessment

CONDITION.LABEL: Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:sudo grep Version /etc/cma.d/EPOAGENT3700MACX/config.xml
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:sudo grep Version /etc/cma.d/EPOAGENT3700MACX/config.xml

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Checks the status of the OS X host-based firewall.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.2.6 Mac OS Firewall Assessment

CONDITION.LABEL: Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:/usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --getglobalstate
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:/usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --getglobalstate
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:fdesetup status
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:diskutil cs list
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:fdesetup -status

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true for the switch port: • 'dot1x pae authenticator' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch port is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: PAE Authenticator Not Configured

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true for the switch port: • 'authentication port-control auto' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch port is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: 802.1x Authentication on the Port Not Enabled

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true for the switch port: • 'mab' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch port is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: MAB Not Configured

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: When the inspected endpoints connected to the switch port do not match any of the preceding policy sub-rules, the switch port is considered: • Ready for 802.1X authentication.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Switch Port Configuration Ready

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if any one of the following is true on the switch: • 'aaa new-model' is not configured • 'no aaa new-model' is configured When one of these conditions is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: AAA Not Enabled

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'aaa authentication dot1x...' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: 802.1X Authentication Method List Not Created

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'dot1x system-auth-control' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: Dot1X Not Globally Enabled

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'radius-server host <IP address>' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication .
INNER_RULE.NAME: RADIUS Server Not Configured

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'radius-server...key <string>' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: Key Between Switch and RADIUS Not Configured

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'radius-server vsa send' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Ready for 802.1X authentication • Switch is unable to use VSAs for authorization, for example, ACLs.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Using VSA Not Enabled

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the switch: • 'aaa server radius dynamic-author' is not configured When this condition is true, the switch is considered: • Ready for 802.1X authentication • Switch is unable to respond to re-authentication (CoA) requests initiated by the plugin.
INNER_RULE.NAME: RADIUS Re-Authentication Not Configured

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: When the inspected switch does not match any of the preceding policy sub-rules, the switch is considered: • Ready for 802.1X authentication.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Switch Configuration Ready

RULE.DESCRIPTION: A single device IP that contains more than 1 MAC address in 10 seconds

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Devices that have have been previously identified as "Non Compliant Devices" have limited network access for remediation. Virtual Firewall is a fallback restrict action for any subrule, depending on vendor interoperability.

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Action is vendor specific. Select the appropriate action.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Non Compliant Wireless Devices (block or role change by vendor)

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Blocking all access other than remediation servers using ACL exceptions to grant access. ACL exceptions must be editied for specific environments.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Non Compliant Wired Cisco/Brocade - ACL <edit Exceptions>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Select a VLAN, by number or name, which will provide access to Remediation servers only.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Non Compliant Wired Other Switches - VLAN <edit VLAN>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Edit vFW exceptions to allow access to the remediation servers.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unknown Device Location <edit Exceptions>

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Devices that have have been previously identified as "Non Corporate Devices" are restricted from network access by this policy.
RULE.NAME: 2.1 Non Corporate Device Control <edit VLAN & WLAN actions, List values>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: The two configured actions are vendor specific. Select the appropriate action.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unathorized Wireless Devices <edit action>
Unauthorized Wired Other Switches - VLAN <edit VLAN>

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Windows" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Windows sub-policy. All detected Windows devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
When Windows devices are not manageable by CounterACT the remaining sub-policies use various available attributes to separate possible corporate machines needing maintenance from suspected guests and known unauthorized windows devices.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: 4.1.9 SecureConnector Audit Windows

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Machines managed via SecureConnector with deployment type "Dissolvable", are added to the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
INNER_RULE.NAME: SecureConnector Managed (Dissolvable)

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Machines managed via SecureConnector with deployment type "Permanent as an Application", are added to the "Managed Windows Devices" group. "Start SecureConnector" action is performed to change deployment type to "Permanent as an Service".
INNER_RULE.NAME: SecureConnector Managed (PaaA)

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Machines managed via SecureConnector with deployment type "Permanent as a Service", are added to the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
INNER_RULE.NAME: SecureConnector Managed (PaaS)
SecureConnector Running AND NOT SC Managed
SecureConnector Installed AND NOT SC Managed

RULE.DESCRIPTION: If there are corporate manageable Mobile devices on the network, a separate 1.2.3.2 Mobile Device Manageability policy should be created and properly rolled out using criteria from the corporate MDM.
RULE.NAME: 4.1.3 Mobile Devices by OS

INNER_RULE.NAME: PW Last Set older than 3 months

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Managed Devices such as Windows, OSX, and Switches can be kept on the corporate network while devices not authorized can be moved to a different network.
RULE.NAME: 2.3.1.2 Unathorized Devices

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Scenario 1- Guest Devices on dedicated network
Currently In Policy A dedicated Guest network has been assigned as a segment and we are looking at all devices on that network.
Scenario 2 - No dedicated network
Group Membership will have to be used from each assesment, not currently enforced.
RULE.NAME: 2.3.1.1 Device Registration

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Devices flagged as guest, login prompt and waiting for login
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unregistered Guests

PARAM.VALUE: Dear Guest, Welcome to the organizational network. In order to connect, please complete this form and click the Register button.

PARAM.NAME: message

Dear User, In order to connect to the network please enter
your name and password below.

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy enables Guest Registration for any host that has been added to the "Guest Registration" group by another policy.
Typically this is handled at the Clarification layer, but can be used at any other layer as required.
RULE.NAME: 2.3.2.1 Guest Control - ACL Only

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE: CounterAct Guest Registration triggered for host {ip} with MAC {mac}

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Members of the "Approved Corp Guests" group will be moved to the guest VLAN, but are not prompted for Guest Registration or Login.
Use this in scenarios where specific machines are accepted by the organization, such as the CEO's IPAD, but should not be on the Corporate network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Approved Corp Guests-No registration

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Once signed in as an approved guest the Virtual Firewall will be released and the guest granted access to the Guest network (access should be defined by corporate policy and a control action (vFW, ACL, VLAN) inserted here if required..
This rule identifies unmanaged systems that have had an approved GUEST user login in via the Guest Login Page.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Signed In as Corporate User Hosts

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Once signed in as an approved guest the Virtual Firewall will be released and the guest granted access to the Guest network (access should be defined by corporate policy and a control action (vFW, ACL, VLAN) inserted here if required..
This rule identifies unmanaged systems that have had an approved GUEST user login in via the Guest Login Page.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Signed In as GUEST Hosts

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Present the Guest Authentication screen and allow for login or registration.
Until the user has been approved and successfully logged in, virtual firewall all traffic.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Guest Hosts

PARAM.NAME: guest_msg
PARAM.VALUE: Dear Guest, Welcome to the Forescout Training network. In order to connect please fill the form below and click the Sign Up button.

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE: Dear User, In order to connect to the network please enter your name and password below. If you have not yet registered, please use the link above to do so now. -insert acceptable use policy-

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Use this rule to restrict non-compliant hosts from general network access.
Enable either the ACL action, based on organizational requirements.
Add outbound blocking exceptions for servers/ports used by remediation processes, such as SCCM, EPO, SEP, etc.
Allows inbound access for inspection purposes.
RULE.NAME: 2.3.2.3 Remediation Hosts ACL

PARAM.NAME: button_text
PARAM.VALUE: I confirm reading the message above

PARAM.NAME: message
message

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
The sub-policy identifies if switch properties are available for a host that has been sent to the Remediation policy.
If so, then a switch port ACL or move to VLAN action will be successful.
Be sure to enter appropriate exemptions to the ACL, or VACLS to the Remediation VLAN, to allow access to remediation servers/resources from hosts in this zone.
INNER_RULE.NAME: If on a managed Switch THEN Remediate with ACL

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
For Remediation hosts that are not on a managed switch, default to the Virtual Firewall for limiting host access. Be sure to enter exemptions for any remediation servers/resources that need to be accessible to hosts in this policy.
The effectiveness of this sub-policy is determined by:
1. The appliance being set to "Normal" mode, allowing packet engine interaction with the network.
2. Coverage on the channel. vFirewall can only reset traffic that has been sent to the monitor interface via a SPAN session or TAP and enabled on the channel.
INNER_RULE.NAME: When not on a managed Switch apply Virtual Firewall

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Use this rule to block unathorized hosts from ALL outbound network access.
Enable either the VLAN or ACL action, based on organizational requirements.
RULE.NAME: 2.3.2.2 Quarantine Hosts ACL

PARAM.NAME: button_text
PARAM.VALUE: I confirm reading the message above

PARAM.NAME: message
message

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
The sub-policy identifies if switch properties are available for a host that has been sent to Quarantine.
If so, then a switch port ACL or move to VLAN action will be successful.
INNER_RULE.NAME: If on a managed Switch THEN Quarantine ACL

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
For Quarantined hosts that are not on a managed switch, default to the Virtual Firewall for limiting host access.
The effectivness of this sub-policy is determined by:
1. The appliance being set to "Normal" mode, allowing packet engine interaction with the network.
2. Coverage on the channel. vFirewall can only reset traffic that has been sent to the monitor interface via a SPAN session or TAP and enabled on the channel.
INNER_RULE.NAME: When not on a managed Switch apply Virtual Firewall

PARAM.NAME: message

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: The sub-policy identifies if switch properties are available for a host that has been sent to the Guest Network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: If on a managed Switch THEN move to Guest VLAN

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: The sub-policy identifies if switch properties are available for a host that has been sent to the Guest Network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: If on a managed Switch THEN move Quarantine Hosts to Quarantine VLAN

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: The sub-policy identifies if switch properties are available for a host that has been sent to the Guest Network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: If on a managed Switch THEN move Remediation Hosts to Remediation VLAN

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
For Guest hosts that are not on a managed switch, default to the Virtual Firewall for limiting host access.
The effectivness of this sub-policy is determined by:
1. The appliance being set to "Full Enforcement" mode, allowing packet engine interaction with the network.
2. Coverage on the channel. vFirewall can only reset traffic that has been sent to the monitor interface via a SPAN session or TAP and enabled on the channel.
INNER_RULE.NAME: When not on a managed Switch apply Virtual Firewall

PARAM.NAME: subject
PARAM.VALUE: CounterACT: Unmanaged Machine on Unmanaged Switch event at {ip}

PARAM.NAME: message

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy enables Guest Registration for any host that has been added to the "Guest Registration" group by another policy.
Typically this is handled at the Clarification layer, but can be used at any other layer as required.
If VLAN switching will be used the action typically should be enabled at the main rule level to avoid policy loops. If vFW or ACL actions will be used, insert them as appropriate in the sub-policies below.
RULE.NAME: 2.3.3.2 Guest Control-STAGING

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Members of the "Approved Corp Guests" group will be moved to the guest VLAN, but are not prompted for Guest Registration or Login.
Use this in scenarios where specific machines are accepted by the organization, such as the CEO's IPAD, but should not be on the Corporate network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Approved Corp Guests-No registration

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Once signed in as an approved guest the Virtual Firewall will be released and the guest granted access to the Guest VLAN.
This rule identifies unmanaged systems that have had a corporate user log in via an account on one of the User Directory Servers.
This slightly higher elevation of trust may warrant a seperate set of ACLs (vFW, VLAN or ACL) based on defined organizational goals.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Signed In as Corporate Hosts

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Once signed in as an approved guest the Virtual Firewall will be released and the guest granted access to the Guest network (access should be defined by corporate policy and a control action (vFW, ACL, VLAN) inserted here if required..
This rule identifies unmanaged systems that have had an approved GUEST user login in via the Guest Login Page.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Signed In as GUEST Hosts

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Present the Guest Authentication screen and allow for login or registration.
Until the user has been approved and successfully logged in, virtual firewall all traffic.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Guest Hosts

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Use this rule to block unathorized hosts from ALL outbound network access.
Enable either the VLAN or ACL action, based on organizational requirements.
RULE.NAME: 2.3.3.4 Quarantine Hosts

PARAM.NAME: button_text
PARAM.VALUE: I confirm reading the message above

PARAM.NAME: message
message

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
The sub-policy identifies if switch properties are available for a host that has been sent to Quarantine.
If so, then a switch port ACL or move to VLAN action will be successful.
INNER_RULE.NAME: If on a managed Switch THEN Quarantine VLAN

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
For Quarantined hosts that are not on a managed switch, default to the Virtual Firewall for limiting host access.
The effectivness of this sub-policy is determined by:
1. The appliance being set to "Normal" mode, allowing packet engine interaction with the network.
2. Coverage on the channel. vFirewall can only reset traffic that has been sent to the monitor interface via a SPAN session or TAP and enabled on the channel.

This slightly higher elevation of trust may warrant a seperate set of ACLs (vFW, VLAN or ACL) based on defined organizational goals.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Signed In as Corporate Hosts

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Once signed in as an approved guest the Virtual Firewall will be released and the guest granted access to the Guest network (access should be defined by corporate policy and a control action (vFW, ACL, VLAN) inserted here if required..
This rule identifies unmanaged systems that have had an approved GUEST user login in via the Guest Login Page.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Signed In as GUEST Hosts

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Present the Guest Authentication screen and allow for login or registration.
Until the user has been approved and successfully logged in, virtual firewall all traffic.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Guest Hosts

PARAM.NAME: guest_msg
PARAM.VALUE: Dear Guest, Welcome to the Forescout Training network. In order to connect please fill the form below and click the Sign Up button.

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE: Dear User, In order to connect to the network please enter your name and password below. If you have not yet registered, please use the link above to do so now. -insert acceptable use policy-

Conference Room-Exempted Machine move to Production

Printers VLAN AND Classified as Printer BUT NOT on Printers Exempt List

NOT on Printers VLAN AND in Printers Exempt List OR Classified as Printer
